items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty suggests a weak start; US, Asian markets fall
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street pulled back on Thursday as investors evaluated key economic indicators ahead of the Federal Reserve's meeting next week. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 234.44 points, or 0.53%, to 43,914.12, the S&P 500 lost 32.94 points, or 0.54%, to 6,051.25 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 132.05 points, or 0.66%, to 19,902.84.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a weak start for the day.

items.title: Live: Will Nifty Hold 24,500 Support Level As Weakness Continues? HAL, Zomato In Focus| Opening Bell
items.description: Asian markets fell as investors assessed China’s stimulus pledges following a high-level economic meeting, where the country reaffirmed its policy shifts and growth-boosting plans. Wall Street ended lower, with the Dow logging its 6th straight decline, marking its longest losing streak since April. European markets also slipped after the ECB cut rates by 25 basis points. GIFT Nifty signals a subdued start, while US 10-year Treasury yields surged above 4.3% following concerning inflation reports. The dollar strengthened as fresh inflation data showed US PPI rising 0.4% in November, above estimates of 0.2%. Oil prices edged lower as the IEA's surplus forecast offset optimism surrounding rate cuts, while gold slid from its 5-week high. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder NeoTrader and A Balasubramanian, MD&CEO, Aditya Birla Sun life AMC Ltd

items.title: Taking Stock: Friday blockbuster! Sensex, Nifty recover more than 2% from day’s low
items.description: For the week, BSE Sensex added 0.7 percent and Nifty rose 0.4 percent.

items.title: Live: Nifty, Sensex See Solid Recovery From Day's Low|Infosys, IOC In Focus| Closing Bell
items.description: Sensex recovered over 2% from the day’s low, while Nifty rebounded more than 500 points. Bank Nifty saw a sharp recovery of over 1,000 points, led by buying in FMCG, auto, and IT stocks. However, broader markets underperformed with weak breadth favoring losers, while metals and realty stocks lagged. Top Nifty gainers included Airtel, Kotak Bank, Ultratech, ITC, Titan, and HUL, while Shriram Fin, IndusInd, Tata Steel, Hindalco, and JSW Steel were among the top losers. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they discuss the stocks on their radar.
